revised_title: The Mechanism of Secondary Electron Emission and Soft X-Ray Generation
tldr: The author investigates the process of secondary electron emission and the generation of soft X-rays when electrons strike a solid surface. They propose a mechanism where electrons either interact with the crystal structure or with free electrons, leading to the emission of secondary electrons and the production of soft X-rays. The author discusses two alternatives for the generation of true secondary electrons and suggests further experiments to test their validity.
